bibl.title: Ernest Hutchinson v. City of Seattle.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21 US Circuit Courts, Western District Of Washington, Seattle; Law Register Northern Division, 1899-1906, vol2.

div1.p: Received copy of within and answer and return This 23 Day of April Carrol & Carroll Attys for Petitioner
United States Circuit Court for the District of Washington
In for the Petition of Ernest Hutchinson for a Writ of Habeas Corpus No. 1183 Appearance.
To the Clerk of the above Entitled Court:
You will please enter our appearance as attorneys for Chief of Police T.R. Delaney in the above entitled cause
Mitchell Gillian Ellis J. H.G Wilson
United State Circuit Court District of Washington.
Appearance
FILED IN THE Filed U.S. Circuit Court 190 APR 23 1904 Clerk Reeved Ayres H.M. Deputy Clerk
Mitchell Gillian Ellis and H.A. Wilson For
WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS Printed and Sold by the Puget Sound Printing CO., Tacoma, Wash.
United States of America
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATE Ninth Judicial Circuit -- District of Washington Northern DIVISION
IN THE MATTER OF ERNEST HUTCHINSON ON HABEAS CORPUS
The President of the United State of America
To THOMAS DELANEY, Chief of Police, Seattle, Washington.
Greeting:

You are Hereby Commanded, That you have the body of Ernest Hutchinson by you imprisoned and detained, as it is said, together with the time and cause of such imprisonment and detention, by whatsoever name he shall be called or charged, before the Honorable the Circuit Court of the United States, for the Ninth Judicial Circuit, District of Washington, at the Court-room of said Court, in the City of Seattle Washington on the eleventh day of May, 1904, 189 at 10 o'clock A.M., to do an receive what shall then be considered in the premises. And have you then and there this Writ.

Witness, the Honorable MELVILLE W. FULLER, Chief Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States, and the seal of said Circuit Court, this 14th day of April, in the year of our Lord one thousand eight nine hundred and ninety four, and of our Independence the 128th. A.REEVES AYRES. Clerk By H.M.

In obedience to the within Writ, I hereby produce the body of as within directed and return that I hold in my custody, by virtue of that I served the personally on Thos. R Delaney at Seattle on the 14 day of April 1904 C.B. Hopkins U.S. Marshal
Seattle May 5 1904
By John Things Deputy
Marshall fees Service 200 Mileage 12 212
No. 1183 Circuit Court of the United States, NINTH JUDICIAL CIRCUIT, District of Washington Nov Division
IN THE MATTER OF Ernest Hutchinson ON HABEAS CORPUS
WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS AND RETURN THERETO.
Filed on return, this 5th day May, 1904 189 A. Reeves Ayres Clerk
By A.N. Moore Deputy Clerk
IN THE UNITED STATES CIRCUIT COURT OF THE NINTH CIRCUIT, DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON.
In the matter of the Petition of ERNEST HUTCHINSON for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
No. 1183 STIPULATION
It is hereby stipulated and agreed by and between the respective attorneys for the petitioner and the respondent in the above entitles casue as follows, to wit:
That the Honorable Judge of said Court consenting thereto, the petitioner and respondent may file briefs herein;

That the petitioner shall serve his brief on respondent and within (5) days thereof respondent shall serve and file his brief and within two (2) days thereof the petitioner may reply to said brief of respondent and thereafter the case shall be closed and submitted upon said briefs unless his Honor, the Judge of said Court, shall desire oral or other discussion of the cause upon the part of the petitioner and respondent:

It is further stipulated and agreed, his Honor, the Judge of said Court consenting thereto, that the petitioner need not be produced in said Court and that for the purposes of this cause it is admitted as hereinabove mentioned as regards said petitioner.
Carroll & Carroll Attorneys for Petitioner
Mitchell WIlliam Ellis H.A. Wilson Attorneys for Respondent.
In the United States Circuit Court of the Ninth Circuit District of Washington
In the matter of the petition of Ernest Hutchinson for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
Stipulation
FILED IN THE U.S. Circuit Court DIST. OF WASHINGTON May 11, 1904
A. Reeves Ayres, Clerk A.N. Moore
Carroll & Carroll Attorneys for Petitioner.
